title: What makes air you breathe thick and what makes it toxic
content: A new study reveals open fires account for over 50% of Delhi's particulate matter pollution, causing visible smog. However, transport and industry are major sources of toxic gases like benzene, contributing to invisible chemical toxicity. Addressing both requires distinct strategies for cleaner air.

title: ‘Main kyu gaali khaun’: Nitin Gadkari orders QR codes on highway sites
content: The road transport ministry is leveraging social media for highway project transparency. NHAI and builders will now upload construction videos on YouTube for public feedback. QR codes on national highways will display contractor and official details, ensuring accountability for road quality. This initiative aims to enhance public participation and deliver international-standard roads.

title: ‘I paid them all’: Ex-BPCL CFO claims he had to bribe Bengaluru officials after daughter's death
content: A former BPCL CFO alleged he was forced to pay bribes for services related to his daughter's death, from ambulance arrangements to obtaining official documents. Sivakumar K detailed his experience on LinkedIn, highlighting the open demands for bribes and questioning the fate of the poor. Bengaluru police have intervened and assured action.

title: How Nvidia's 'Zero marketshare' problem continues, Trump's talks with Xi will not help
content: Despite a positive meeting between Presidents Trump and Xi, Nvidia's advanced AI chip sales to China remain uncertain. While chips were discussed generally, President Trump clarified that the US is not authorizing Blackwell accelerators for export, leaving further conversations to Beijing and Nvidia.

title: 8th Pay Commission: How will the new salary levels be calculated? Explained
content: 8th Pay Commission salary hike news: Central government employees and pensioners anticipate higher salaries and pensions as the 8th Pay Commission's Terms of Reference are approved. The commission will submit its report in 18 months, with recommendations likely effective from January 1, 2026.

title: Garbage dumped at doorsteps of Bengaluru homes; here's why
content: Bengaluru authorities are dumping garbage outside homes of litterbugs as a new crackdown. While some residents support the strict measure, others criticize it, citing issues with waste collection and segregation. Officials state the campaign aims to deter public littering and has already reduced garbage black spots.

title: Back-to-office push: Jamie Dimon recalls Steve Jobs; Warns JPMorgan staff on ‘work-from-home’ comfort
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is urging employees back to the office, citing Steve Jobs' philosophy on spontaneous collaboration. Dimon argues remote work hinders mentorship, informal learning, and career growth for younger staff, leading to social and professional isolation. This stance aligns with a growing trend of companies scaling back remote work policies.

title: He said sorry but they took an enraged U-turn: What led to murder of Bengaluru delivery boy
content: A Kalaripayattu trainer allegedly rammed his car into a food delivery agent's scooter after a minor road brush, resulting in the agent's death. The couple, arrested for murder, confessed to the deliberate act after being identified through CCTV footage. They were sent to 14-day judicial custody.

title: 'Can't break the deal': Pak says 'US drones behind Afghan strikes'; makes shocking admission
content: Pakistan has admitted to a US drone agreement during Pakistan-Afghanistan peace talks, causing Afghan negotiators to demand written guarantees against drone use in their airspace. The talks collapsed as Pakistan blamed Kabul for refusing to act against militants, with Islamabad vowing to protect its people from terrorism.

title: Cloud disruption: Azure services restored; Microsoft reveals what went wrong and why
content: Microsoft's Azure cloud services have been fully restored after a widespread outage caused by a configuration error in Azure Front Door. The disruption impacted millions of users across critical platforms like Microsoft 365 and Outlook for several hours. Despite the incident, Microsoft reported strong Q3 earnings, highlighting resilience and continued growth.

title: 'Timed for Trump visit, planned pan-India stir': Delhi police on 2020 riots case
content: Delhi Police opposed bail for Umar Khalid and others in the 2020 riots UAPA case, citing chats about Donald Trump as evidence of a pre-planned, pan-India conspiracy. The affidavit claims the plot aimed to attract international media attention and portray the CAA as a pogrom against Muslims, leading to 53 deaths and property damage.

title: AAP leader shot in head: Retired DSP opens fire at Punjab wedding
content: An AAP functionary, Nitin Nanda, was shot in the head by retired Chandigarh Police DSP Dilsher Singh after a quarrel at a wedding. The incident, likely stemming from a 15-year property dispute, has led to an attempted murder case against the former DSP and two others who are on the run.

title: 'I'll not continue here': Engineer's last message to boss goes viral; when should you quit a job?
content: A viral X post by an engineer has stirred widespread reflection after he shared a WhatsApp chat between a manager and an employee that unfolded from apology to quiet resignation. The employee’s final words — “I am done, sir. Resignation mail bhej raha hu. I will not continue here” — symbolised emotional exhaustion and the quiet courage of walking away.

title: ‘Sorry’ before challan: Gurugram cops get polite
content: Gurugram's traffic police are rolling out a refreshing initiative, promoting a culture of politeness on the roads. By integrating 'golden words' such as 'please' and 'sorry' into their communication, officers aim to create a more welcoming experience for everyone.

title: Indian-origin truck driver arrested on US-Canada border with 77 kg cocaine
content: An Indian-origin truck driver, Surj Singh Salaria, was arrested in Canada with nearly 77 kg of cocaine valued at $7 million. Charged with multiple offenses, he was denied bail. This incident occurs amid heightened scrutiny of Indian truck drivers in North America and ongoing disputes over cross-border drug trafficking.

title: Jaya Bachchan says Agastya Nanda won’t follow the herd as ‘Ikkis’ trailer drops
content: Agastya Nanda, grandson of Amitabh Bachchan, transitions from OTT debut in 'The Archies' to a powerful theatrical launch in 'Ikkis'. He portrays war hero Arun Khetarpal, earning praise from Jaya and Amitabh Bachchan. Directed by Sriram Raghavan, the film promises a compelling narrative of courage and patriotism, featuring Dharmendra and Jaideep Ahlawat.

title: 'Yuvrajs out on bail': PM mocks Rahul, Tejashwi; invokes '5 Ks' to attack oppn
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi accused the Congress and RJD of insulting Chhath Puja and using it for votes, calling their leaders "yuvrajs" from corrupt families. He stated that while his government seeks Unesco heritage status for the festival, opposition leaders dismiss it as "drama." PM Modi also criticized the alliance's "unrealistic promises" and alleged a focus on "loot" and "misgovernance."

title: BCCI's power play: Chappell echoes Broad’s explosive charge — 'India control world cricket'
content: Former India coach Greg Chappell has corroborated Chris Broad's claims of BCCI's influence, revealing an offer from Jagmohan Dalmiya to reduce Sourav Ganguly's suspension in 2005. Broad previously alleged pressure to be lenient on India for slow over-rates. These revelations highlight concerns about political interference in cricket's judicial processes, with India's financial power reportedly giving them control over the ICC.

title: Kaelin Bradshaw, 29, dies after sharing emotional final TikTok video
content: TikTok sensation Kaelin Bradshaw, 29, has passed away after a brave battle with rare stage 4 bile duct cancer. Her husband confirmed her peaceful passing, surrounded by family. Kaelin had openly shared her health journey online, recently entering hospice care and urging support for her husband through a GoFundMe. Her final message highlighted Austin's unwavering devotion.

title: Delhi’s air turns ‘very poor’ as haze and fog blanket city; AQI hits ‘severe’
content: Delhi woke up to a thick haze and fog on Thursday, pushing air quality into the 'very poor' category with an AQI of 357. Visibility dropped significantly as calm winds and fog trapped pollutants. Several areas, including Akshardham and Anand Vihar, experienced 'severe' air quality. This marks a sharp deterioration from previous days.

title: Vi shares slump 12%: SC limit on AGR relief hits company stock
content: Vodafone Idea's stock plunged after the Supreme Court's written order clarified that relief on adjusted gross revenue dues was limited to a specific Rs 9,450 crore demand. Hopes for a broader waiver of penalties and interest, crucial for the debt-laden firm's survival, were dashed, impacting investor sentiment and share prices.

title: Melting Arctic ice unlocks a secret that could rewrite Earth’s climate equation
content: Melting Arctic ice is revealing a hidden ecosystem where bacteria convert nitrogen gas into nutrients, fueling algae growth. This process, previously thought impossible under thick ice, is now seen as vital for the Arctic food web and potentially for absorbing atmospheric carbon. Scientists are exploring whether this discovery offers a climate benefit or introduces new uncertainties.

title: Boost for India! Trump admin extends waiver on Chabahar Port sanctions
content: The US has granted India an extension on sanctions waivers for Iran's Chabahar Port until early next year. This crucial port facilitates India's regional connectivity plans, providing vital access to Afghanistan and Central Asia.

title: NEET UG 2025: NMC releases revised seat matrix; region-wise list here
content: The National Medical Commission has revised the MBBS and BDS seat matrix for 2025-26, resulting in a reduction of 50 seats to a total of 1,28,875. This adjustment follows the addition of new seats, with a clarification issued regarding previous discrepancies. The NMC also announced the stray vacancy round schedule for NEET UG 2025 counselling, commencing November 4.

title: ‘6 ball daal...’: Stump mic picks Pant joking with bowler during IND A vs SA A - video
content: Rishabh Pant's infectious on-field energy was evident as he led India A against South Africa A. The wicketkeeper's animated pep talks to bowlers Tanush Kotian and Manav Suthar, a mix of humor and confidence, were captured by the stump mic. These matches are crucial for Pant's return to action after injury.

title: SC rejects Bihar official's plea seeking exemption from stray dog hearing
content: The Supreme Court rejected Bihar Chief Secretary Pratyaya Amrit's plea to skip a hearing on the stray dog menace, stating he has no role in election duties. The court emphasized his mandatory appearance, citing ongoing incidents and the country's international image. Other states and UTs were also ordered to appear with explanations for delays.

title: 'A great success': Trump will visit China in April; Xi will 'be coming sometime after'
content: President Trump announced a visit to China in April following "great success" in talks with President Xi Jinping, who will visit the US later.  Trade tensions eased with a tariff reduction and China resuming soybean purchases, while rare earth disputes and fentanyl shipments were addressed.

title: From rare earths to tariff cuts- Trump, Xi discuss trade: Key decisions made
content: US President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping held crucial talks, leading to tariff reductions on Chinese goods and fentanyl. China will immediately resume significant soybean purchases, signaling a potential turning point in trade relations. Trump expressed optimism, rating the meeting highly and hinting at a diplomatic reset with a future visit to China.

title: Shreyas' family reaches Sydney: Cricketer out of danger; sister shares update
content: Shreyas Iyer is recovering well in Sydney after a serious spleen injury sustained during an ODI against Australia. His family has joined him as he undergoes treatment. Doctors have described the injury as rare, but the BCCI confirms significant improvement and Iyer is on the path to recovery, with specialists monitoring his progress.

title: Delivery boy chased, crushed after Bengaluru road rage spat; couple arrested for murder
content: A Kalaripayattu trainer and his wife have been arrested for deliberately running over a 24-year-old food delivery agent in Bengaluru. CCTV footage revealed the couple intentionally rammed the agent's scooter after a minor brush, then returned to collect broken car parts. The victim died from his injuries.

title: JNU Polls: Stage set as 20 candidates vie for top four posts; check full list here
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University's Election Committee has finalized the candidate list for the 2025-26 Students' Union polls, with twenty contestants vying for four central panel posts. A triangular contest is expected between the Left alliance, ABVP, and NSUI, alongside independent and smaller group candidates. Polling is scheduled for November 4, with results anticipated by November 6.

title: Helmetless, missing number plate: Biker gets Thane traffic cop fined; watch viral video
content: A Thane traffic constable was fined Rs 2,000 for riding a friend's scooter without a valid license and violating multiple road safety norms. The incident, captured in a viral video, led to an internal review and a reminder to all personnel about mandatory law compliance.

title: ‘Jao babu jungle mai jao’: Gentle voices lead elephant herd back to forest - Watch
content: A heartwarming video from Chhattisgarh shows local volunteers, the 'hathi mitra dal,' gently guiding a herd of 15 wild elephants, including a calf, back into the forest.  Using calm voices and mutual respect, the elephants responded positively, turning away from the road. This incident highlights a unique approach to human-wildlife coexistence.

title: Watch: Drunk teacher in Gujarat drives 750m with motorcyclist on hood after crash
content: A shocking incident unfolded on the Modasa-Lunawada highway where a drunk driver dragged a man on his car's hood for 750 meters with the victim's motorcycle lodged in the fender. Alerted by another motorist, the car was stopped, and the injured were hospitalized. The driver, a teacher, faces severe charges including attempted culpable homicide.

title: Bengaluru horror: Delivery boy crushed after road rage spat; martial arts trainer, wife arrested
content: A Kalaripayattu trainer and his wife were arrested for allegedly murdering a food delivery agent in Bengaluru. Police claim the couple intentionally rammed their car into the agent's scooter after a minor collision, leading to his death. The couple was later seen returning to the scene to collect car parts.

title: NCB Goa Drug Bust: Dawood aide Danish Chikna, wife among 4 held with 1.3kg mephedrone
content: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) dismantled a drug syndicate in Goa, arresting kingpin Danish Merchant, also known as ‘Danish Chikna’, and his wife Henna Bharat Shah. The operation led to the seizure of 1.3kg of mephedrone and the apprehension of four individuals, including key conspirators. Merchant, a notorious repeat offender, was previously involved in multiple NDPS cases.

title: Bollywood-style comeback! Pak spinner returns after watching Dhoni biopic
content: Inspired by a Bollywood film, Pakistan's Usman Tariq left a stable job in Dubai to chase his cricket dreams.  The 27-year-old mystery spinner, now in Pakistan's T20I squad, impressed with 20 wickets in the CPL.  His unique, side-arm action, stemming from a physical peculiarity, was cleared after testing, marking a remarkable comeback.

title: 'Don’t have to be rich to pursue degree abroad': Indian student on studying in Canada
content: Indian student Saransh Ahuja shares his journey of studying in Canada without immense wealth. A UFV graduate in Computer Information Systems, he highlights practical learning, affordable living, part-time work, and scholarships. From adapting to independent life and building networks to securing a work permit post-graduation, his story offers a realistic, inspiring guide for aspiring international students.

title: Can heart attacks be inherited? What family history & genes mean for your heart
content: Heart disease in families is a warning, not a destiny. While genes play a role, lifestyle choices hold immense power. Knowing your family history empowers you to take control. Experts advise healthy eating, regular exercise, and quitting smoking. Regular health check-ups are crucial. Proactive steps can rewrite your health narrative.

title: How Yesavage met the moment and pushed the Dodgers to the brink
content: Six months after making his pro debut, Toronto's unflappable rookie shut down L.A.'s lineup and quieted a sold-out Dodger Stadium in a World Series start for the ages.

title: Jays ride Yesavage's record 12 K's to cusp of title
content: Trey Yesavage set a World Series rookie record with 12 strikeouts, propelling the Blue Jays past the Dodgers 6-1 and moving them one win away from their first championship since 1993.

title: Dodgers' bats flail again, putting season on brink
content: The Dodgers' offense fell flat again, managing four hits while striking out 15 times in a 6-1 loss to the Blue Jays that put them in a 3-2 hole in the World Series.

title: Reaves' run rolls on as buzzer-beater lifts Lakers
content: Austin Reaves continued his dream week, adding to a 51-point performance and a 41-point game with a floater at the buzzer that rescued the Lakers.

title: Sources: Twins pick Shelton to be next manager
content: The Twins are turning to Derek Shelton to be their new manager, sources confirmed to ESPN on Wednesday.

title: La. Gov.: LSU AD won't select new football coach
content: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry told reporters Wednesday that LSU athletic director Scott Woodward won't be involved in selecting the Tigers' new football coach in the wake of Brian Kelly's firing.

title: Hawks' Young avoids ACL injury, but MRI to follow
content: Trae Young was ruled out of the Hawks' game at Brooklyn with a right knee sprain after teammate Mouhamed Gueye fell into his leg late in the first quarter Wednesday.

title: Sears' hat trick sees USWNT close window in rout
content: Emma Sears scored a hat trick as the United States closed out the October window with a one-sided 6-0 win over New Zealand on Wednesday in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Marchand steps away to help friend after tragedy
content: Brad Marchand is stepping away from the Panthers to help coach a junior hockey team in place of friend JP MacCallum, whose daughter died last week of cancer.

title: What to expect at the NFL trade deadline for every team: Perfect fits, candidates to move and big needs
content: Let's outline deadline plans for all 32 franchises, including who could be moved or targeted before 4 p.m. ET on Nov. 4. Here's everything to know.

title: What we're hearing on the trade deadline and Week 9
content: The latest on Breece Hall, Trey Hendrickson, Jakobi Meyers and several under-the-radar trade targets.

content: Our insiders break down standout moments and answer the biggest questions from the first days of the NBA season.

title: Men's college basketball megapreview, predictions for this season
content: Can Florida repeat? Here's your guide to the new season, from Final Four picks to conference winner predictions.

title: Top 25 women's NCAA basketball players ranked going into 2025-26
content: A sophomore sits atop our preseason rankings, which include multiple players from UConn, UCLA and LSU.

title: 'Toughest player I've ever seen': The Legend of Haynes King
content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

title: What to know with 100 days until the Milan-Cortina Olympics
content: The 2026 Olympics will have more sports and more athletes than any Winter Games in history. We've got 100 things to know.

title: Slot machine: Carabao Cup gamble puts pressure on Liverpool's next match
content: Arne Slot's Liverpool continued their bad run of form on Wednesday, bowing out of the Carabao Cup at the hands of Crystal Palace and heaping more pressure on the Dutchman in the process.

title: Pochettino the player: How Mauricio Pochettino's playing days shaped the USMNT coach
content: Before he was a manager, there was Mauricio Pochettino the player, and his old teammates saw signs of the successful coaching career that was to come.

title: 'No, no, it was an optical illusion': How the NFL shut down a field goal controversy
content: Did Vikings' Will Reichard hit a camera wire on his FG attempt in London? He says yes -- the NFL says no.

title: Cam Skattebo's injury: What it means for the RB, the Giants and their future
content: Skattebo's injury is a massive loss for the Giants. It's equally demoralizing for the team and the fan base.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams land after one week of regular-season play
content: Hot starts or early burnouts? Where all 30 teams rank after one week of the 2025-26 NBA regular season.

title: Hoop Collective Q&A: What are the next steps in the NBA's gambling investigations?
content: ESPN spoke with former federal prosecutor Kate Reilly for an in-depth look at what comes next in the NBA gambling investigations.

title: Pushed to the periphery, Nwaneri seizes his chance to shine for Arsenal
content: Ethan Nwaneri has hardly gotten on the pitch after his breakout last season. On Wednesday, he reminded everyone how much talent he possesses.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo's race to 1,000 goals: When will he reach that remarkable number?
content: It seems like a matter of when, not if, Ronaldo scores his 1,000th goal, especially after reaching 950.

title: Why are USWNT players signing with clubs in Europe -- and can the NWSL stop it?
content: While NWSL execs worry about USWNT players choosing European clubs, the lure of UEFA Women's Champions League clubs isn't going away.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Rams, Chargers among top options in Week 9
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 9, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Why you may want to sit Bo Nix, start Travis Hunter and trade Christian McCaffrey
content: Liz has feelings about who you should start and sit this week and a fact to consider about Christian McCaffrey

title: NFL matchup rankings: Upgrade Daniel Jones, downgrade Travis Kelce
content: The most and least favorable matchups for Week 9 at quarterback, running back, wide receiver and tight end.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 9
content: Does Notre Dame need to run the table? We try to make sense of the constantly evolving playoff picture conference by conference.

title: What's left for the 2026 recruiting class: Coaching changes, flips to watch and more
content: We've updated our player rankings. There's a new top QB and new five-star, but classes could be in flux.

title: 'A moment of glory': How the daughter of two Ohio State 'i dotters' fulfilled her destiny
content: Sydney Reeves grew up with two Ohio State sousaphone players for parents. She always knew what she had to do.

title: 200 plays on a wristband?! Why some NFL QBs wear play sheets on their wrists and others don't
content: Some QBs like the way wristbands speed up the process, but others, such as Dak Prescott, don't want to lose eye contact.

title: Why the Saints are turning to QB Tyler Shough now
content: After benching Spencer Rattler during their Week 8 loss, the Saints will start their second-round pick Sunday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Haaland to replace Vinícius at Real Madrid?
content: Real Madrid could look to Man City striker Erling Haaland to replace forward Vinícius Júnior. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: AQI-puncture: 65% of Haryana pollution monitors go offline
content: Ipsita Pati is an environment journalist with over a decade of experience, currently reporting for The Times of India. She covers climate change, land use, and green laws, with a focus on regulatory accountability. Her work highlights the environmental implications of policy decisions and development on ground. Read More

title: Kerala Man Arrested For Siphoning Rs 3.5 Crore From Overseas Education Firm
content: Police in Kerala's Ernakulam on Thursday made the second arrest in connection with a Rs 3.5 crore fraud in an overseas education company.

title: US' Largest Pension Fund To Vote Against Musk's $1 Trillion Tesla Pay Deal
content: California Public Employees' Retirement System, the largest public pension plan in the US, is planning to vote against Elon Musk's $1 trillion Tesla Inc. compensation agreement

title: Satellite Images Show Bloodshed, Mass Killings In War-Ravaged Sudan
content: There's been so much bloodshed in war-ravaged Sudan that it is visible even from space. Satellite images from the Yale show a rebel organisation conducting mass killings after capturing El-Fasher.

title: Woman Killed As Rock Falls From Hill, Crashes Through VW Virtus' Sunroof
content: In a horrific accident, a large rock dropped dead on a moving car, smashed the sunroof and hit a woman, killing her on the spot. The incident took place in Tamhini Ghat, a mountain route in Maharashtra.

title: Rohit Pawar Shows Creation Of Fake Aadhaar In Trump's Name, Case Filed
content: Mumbai police have registered an FIR against unidentified persons after NCP (SP) MLA Rohit Pawar showed the preparation of a fake Aadhaar card in US President Donald Trump's name and its use to register bogus voters, officials said on Thursday.

title: Mohammad Azharuddin Set To Join Telangana Cabinet As Minister Tomorrow
content: Former Indian cricket captain and senior Congress leader Mohammad Azharuddin is poised to join the Telangana Cabinet as a minister on Friday, marking his formal entry into the state government.

title: A Ray Of Hope For Mothers Who Lost Their Children In Jhalawar School Tragedy
content: Binti Bai and Raju Bai, two mothers who lost their children in the tragic collapse of a school in Piplodi, Jhalawar, are set to regain their motherhood through recanalisation surgery.

title: Amit Shah Announces Grand Parade On Sardar Patel's 150th Birth Anniversary
content: On the occasion of Rashtriya Ekta Diwas, Home Minister Amit Shah highlighted the monumental role of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel in uniting India post-independence and announced a series of grand celebrations to mark Iron Man's 150th birth anniversary.

title: Revisiting '62 War: When A Rifleman Fought The Chinese For 3 Days, Killed 300
content: After the Chinese People's Liberation Army or PLA launched an attack against India in October 1962, India's brave soldiers fought against all adversities to protect the country.

title: India's Been "Very Good" On Russian Oil Issue: Trump
content: US President Donald Trump reiterated claims that India had significantly reduced its purchases of Russian oil, noting that New Delhi had been "very good" on the issue amid his broader push to economically isolate Moscow through energy sanctions.

title: Adani Power Q2 Revenue Rises To Rs 13,106 Crore, Sells 7.4% More Electricity
content: Adani Power Ltd (APL) on Thursday reported strong continuing operating revenue for Q2 FY26 of Rs 13,106.34 crore, compared to Rs 12,949.12 Crore in Q2 FY25 on the basis of higher volumes

title: Ex-OpenAI, Now At Meta: Researcher Shares How To Land Top AI Jobs
content: A Meta researcher who previously worked at OpenAI says there is a clear path for people hoping to land roles at the world's top artificial intelligence labs.

title: Nitish Katara Murder Convict Dies In Crash, Months After Release From Jail
content: Sukhdev Pehalwan, one of the convicts in the Nitish Katara murder case, has died in an accident in Uttar Pradesh's Kushinagar district, months after he was released from prison after serving a 20-year sentence.

title: Buffaloes, Horses Fetch Crores At Pushkar Fair, Camels Rs 10,000. Here's Why
content: At the iconic Pushkar Fair of Rajasthan, where buffaloes and horses are valued at over a crore of rupees, the "ship of the desert," the camel, is struggling to stay afloat in a shrinking market.

title: Nvidia Touches $5 Trillion Market Value, Crosses India And Japan's GDP
content: Nvidia now surpasses the GDPs of virtually all countries except the United States, China, and Germany.

title: Video: 7 Months Pregnant, Delhi Cop Deadlifts 145 Kg, Wins Bronze
content: Sonika Yadav, who is seven months pregnant, lifted 125 kg in squats, 80 kg in bench press, and 145 kg in deadlift.

title: Kerala Man Pours Hot Fish Curry On Wife's Face After Row Over Black Magic
content: A case has been registered against a man for allegedly pouring hot fish curry on his wife's face following a dispute over performing black magic in this district, police said on Thursday.

title: Kash Patel Slammed For Using $60 Million FBI Jet To Watch Girlfriend Perform
content: FBI Director Kash Patel allegedly used a government jet to attend his girlfriend's singing performance at a wrestling event in Nashville, according to flight records and claims made by a former FBI agent.

title: Retired Officer In Pune Dies Of Shock After Rs 1.2 Crore Digital Arrest Fraud
content: An 82-year-old retired state government officer from Pune collapsed and died of shock after discovering that he and his 80-year-old wife had been duped of Rs 1.19 crore in a "digital arrest" scam.

title: BRS's Big Charge And Demand To Debar Revanth Reddy From Bypoll Campaigning
content: The Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) has lodged a formal complaint against Chief Minister Revanth Reddy and Congress candidate Naveen Yadav, alleging gross violations of the Model Code of Conduct (MCC) ahead of the crucial by-election in Jubilee Hills.

title: What Aidan Hutchinson's extension means, and which pass rushers are getting paid next
content: aidan Hutchinson has been a star for the team from day one . he finished second in the 2022 draft with a team-leading 9.5 sacks and a pro Bowl nod . the move means the franchise will have its best pass rusher for years to come .

title: Why the 6-2 Patriots traded Keion White and Kyle Dugger -- and what could be next
content: the move comes ahead of Tuesday's trade deadline (4 p.m. ET) the Patriots have been one of the NFL's surprise teams and are in first place in the AFC East . the five-time defending division champions will play them at home in week 15 .

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: A new UFC champion and an ex-champ enter women's top 10
content: former bantamweight champion Julianna Pea is back in the top 10 . former featherweight larissa Pacheco loses her eligibility because she has not fought in over a year . heavyweight Francis Ngannou has been replaced by two fighters .

title: ⬇ CFB Bottom 10: Hot seats get hotter
content: "Take this job and shove it I ain't working here no more My woman done left And took all the reasons I was working for You better not try to stand in my way" a-walking out the door "Take This Job and Shove It," Johnny Paycheck Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters, located behind the wall of industrial-sized cooling fans used to keep Pete Thamel's phone and laptop from overheating .

title: What Cade Cunningham is building in Detroit
content: Cade Cunningham lost the ball on offense, but gets it back for the Pistons with a chasedown block . he had just become a first-time All-Star and the driving fo foe . his first postseason win since 2008 was in the playoffs .

title: NBA gambling scandal follows familiar Mafia playbook
content: the alleged connection between the mafia and two former NBA players began through a little-known intermediary . prosecutors allege the intermediary was Robert L. Stroud, 67, a 67-year-old Louisville man with a criminal history . in 1994, he killed a man during an evening playing cards and gambling at a home .

title: Edgecombe overtakes Flagg as ROY favorite; what it means for betting, fantasy
content: VJ Edgecombe ( +110 ) has officially surpassed Cooper Flagg ( +115 ) as the favorite to win the NBA's Rookie of the Year, according to ESPN BET . he is off to an amazing start, averaging 22.3 PPG, 5.8 RPG, 5.5 APG, 3.0 3PG and 1.5 SPG through his first four games while helping the Philadelphia 76ers to a surprising 4-0 start .

title: Unlicensed workers operated boiler in Kumbala plywood factory blast in Kerala; safety lapses uncovered
content: Initial probe indicates the explosion occurred due to low water level and overheating compounded by factory’s failure to act on prior warnings from employees about possible malfunctions

title: TNPCB data on Deepavali underplays real extent of air pollution, says environmental group
content: According to the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board, Chennai’s AQI between 6 a.m. on October 20 and 6 a.m. on October 21 ranged from 190 to 332. However, Poovulagin Nanbargal said the actual pollution levels were far higher

title: Major mishap averted at Sangam Barrage in Nellore
content: The team of 30 NDRF members, 30 SDRF members, 100 police personnel, Krishnapatnam Port Patrol staff, Fire and Irrigation officials brought a 35-tonne boat to the shores preventing it from ramming into the anicut

title: Global study flags cardiovascular crisis, mental health challenge for India
content: The collaborative research indicates India is experiencing a ‘double burden’ with an explosion of lifestyle disorders while infectious diseases persist in some regions

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Congress claims people made up their minds for change
content: Congress alleges that crimes against women have reached their peak under the ‘trouble-engine NDA government’ in Bihar and asks what moral right does PM Modi have to seek votes from them

title: Kerala local body elections 2025: A comprehensive coverage
content: As Kerala gears up for 2025 local body elections, here is a compilation of stories by The Hindu on the upcoming polls. Elections are being held for 23,576 wards across the State

title: As WazirX resumes operations, crypto investors question locked funds and losses
content: WazirX has resumed its operations after a post-hack restructuring exercise, but users complained of steep losses and questioned why some funds are still locked

title: Bihar Assembly polls: INDIA bloc to be wiped out as Rahul Gandhi insulted Chhathi Maiyya, says Amit Shah
content: In a jibe at Congress leader Sonia Gandhi, he called upon people to press on EVM buttons having NDA symbols with such rage that the tremors are "felt in Italy"

title: SIR 2.0: List of documents that can be used for SIR in 12 States and UTs
content: The first phase of the SIR was held in Bihar, following which more than 68 lakh names were deleted from the electoral rolls.

title: Heavy inflow into Pulichintala, Prakasam reservoirs in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Andhra Pradesh State Disaster Management Authority has cautioned residents of low-lying and island villages (Lanka areas) along the Krishna river to remain vigilant

title: West Bengal Governor Ananda Bose appoints permanent Vice-Chancellors for six State universities after long impasse
content: Calcutta University, Jadavpur University, and four others get permanent V-Cs; politicians and academics welcome move

title: India’s skill gap: Why blending academic education with vocational training is key to future jobs
content: Explore the integration of vocational training with academic education to bridge India’s skill gap and enhance employability for future jobs.

title: Government school participation in Karnataka Rajyotsava up as KPS model expands: Minister Madhu Bangarappa
content: The Minister said he and Chief Minister Siddaramaiah were particularly happy to see growing representation from Karnataka Public Schools (KPS)

title: Lottery for BMC ward reservations on November 11: Maharashtra SEC
content: Citizens will be allowed to submit objections and suggestions to the ward reservations between November 14 and 20

title: Kerala man booked for pouring hot fish curry on wife’s face over black magic row
content: As per FIR, the accused allegedly asked his wife to loosen her hair, sit in front of him, and allow him to apply ashes and to tie a locket given by a black-magic practitioner. When she refused, he allegedly poured hot fish curry on her face

title: Weakened cyclone Montha to bring heavy rains in parts of West Bengal
content: “The weather system is likely to move northwards towards east Madhya Pradesh and weaken further,” the India Meteorological Department said in a bulletin

title: Kalinga Literary Festival gears up for its 12th edition in Odisha
content: The KLF 2026 will take place across five venues in Odisha from January 8 to 11, featuring more than 400 eminent speakers and thought leaders from abroad and India, including notable Booker Prize winners

title: Montha cyclone: Crop-wise advisory for farmers amid rains, from ANGRAU
content: ANGRAU Vice-Chancellor Dr. Sarada Jayalakshmi Devi urged farmers to stay alert, ensure timely drainage, and follow the integrated pest and nutrient management measures

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: BJP Yuva Morcha stages black flag protest against Minister Vasavan in Kannur
content: The protesters shouted slogans demanding the Minister’s resignation, holding him responsible for the alleged gold theft in Sabarimala

title: Anti-Maoist operations: CRPF Inspector dies 20 days after suffering IED injury in Jharkhand
content: Inspector Koushal Kumar Mishra suffered severe injuries on his left leg in an improvised explosive device blast that took place during an anti-Maoist operation in the West Singhbhum district of Jharkhand on October 10

title: Two government employees dismissed over suspected terror links in Jammu and Kashmir
content: The employees have been identified as Ghulam Hussain and Majid Iqbal Dar, both serving as teachers in the Education Department

title: Kerala’s withdrawal from PM SHRI scheme will hurt public education, says Union Minister George Kurian
content: Kurian alleges that withdrawal is intended to weaken government schools and cautions that it can push students to seek education in other States

title: From fringe player to powerhouse: the ascent of BJP in Bihar
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party’s (BJP) upward trajectory in Bihar — beginning with its earlier incarnation as the Jana Sangh — can be attributed to its astute understanding of the State’s political landscape, where caste is of paramount importance, both socially and electorally

title: Police register trespass case at Kochi stadium amid political controversy over Messi’s team visit
content: According to FIR, the accused allegedly entered the stadium forcefully without the permission of GCDA authorities and after manhandling security guards

title: Traffic diversions on Srisailam Highway as road caves in near Dindi Reservoir
content: Traffic movement on the highway should resume by tomorrow once the damaged portion is restored, says Achampet Circle Inspector

title: V.D. Satheesan questions Pinarayi’s ‘poll eve sops’, says LDF in Kerala failed to keep 2021 promises
content: Opposition Leader says these were aimed at ‘covering up the embarrassment’ caused by controversy over signing up for PM SHRI project

title: Karur stampede: SC asks victim’s kin to approach CBI amid claims of police coercion
content: A Bench headed by Justice J.K. Maheshwari asked Mr. Prabhakaran, represented by advocate Balaji Srinivasan, to apply to the CBI, to which the Supreme Court had transferred the investigation

title: Lack of accessible toilets in Chennai leaves persons with disabilities in distress
content: Even in accessible toilets, entry can be difficult for wheelchair users because the doors are not wide enough for them to pass through

title: Guntur Municipal Commissioner orders suspension of officials for land encroachment negligence
content: The Commissioner inspected the site near Poojitha School, stopped the illegal construction, and restored the drain boundary with JCBs.

title: Telangana fisherman rescued from Krishna River by Andhra officials
content: Following alerts from Telangana authorities, the Palnadu Collector and SP directed Bellamkonda and Sattenapalli officials to act swiftly

title: Nitish Kumar’s political timeline: key milestones
content: Even after the continuous change in alliance between the BJP and the RJD, Nitish Kumar managed to continuously win in all the elections since 2005 and became the Chief Minister seven times.

title: FIR filed after Rohit Pawar shows creation of fake Aadhaar card in Trump’s name
content: Rohit Pawar, during a press conference on October 16, demonstrated how the fake Aadhaar cards were being prepared on a website and used to register bogus voters.

title: Congress against Assam's development, wants youths to join militancy, alleges Himanta
content: There is no provision in the Constitution that industries will go only to Karnataka. Do they demand that it's their birthright to have all industries there?, says Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Nearly 1,200 evacuated as torrential rains cripple life in Warangal and Hanamkonda
content: Warangal Mayor Gundu Sudharani said around 45 localities under the Greater Warangal Municipal Corporation limits were flooded, prompting the administration to initiate large-scale evacuation and rehabilitation measures.

title: Pune-based gangster Ghaywal is in London, confirms U.K. High Commission
content: We have received a reply from the High Commission. They have confirmed that Ghaywal is in London and is currently on a visitor visa. They also confirmed that he is in London to see his son, says  Deputy Commissioner of Police Sambhaji Kadam

title: HC orders Bachchu Kadu to vacate protest site; CM urges dialogue over disruption
content: Thousands of farmers continue protesting in Nagpur demanding loan waiver; Fadnavis says government open to talks, warns against road blockades.

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: 'NDA government formed through vote chori during Lok Sabha election,' says Rahul Gandhi in Nalanda rally
content: Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, also promised the 'world's best university in Nalanda' if the INDIA bloc is elected in Bihar

title: NDA, LDF look to breach UDF fort in Chengannur
content: Over the past two decades, the UDF has largely held sway over the civic body, spending only a brief period in the opposition. The UDF secured victories in the local body elections of 2010, 2015, and 2020

title: Urdu is the most beautiful language, says Kiren Rijiju
content: The Minority Affairs Minister said Hindu-Muslim harmony is vital for India’s growth, in his address at the 105th foundation day of the Jamia Milia Islamia University

title: Treason case to be filed against Congress leaders for singing Bangladesh national anthem: Assam CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma alleged that singing the anthem was the Opposition party’s  endorsement of the claim by a section of leaders in Bangladesh that the entire northeast region is part of the neighbouring nation

title: Row intensifies over death of person over NRC fears in WB, Trinamool announces protest
content: Trinamool Congress general secretary Abhishek Banerjee told the people that if they see BJP leaders they should,  “tie them up and tell them they will be let go once they produce their father’s and grandfather’s certificates”.

title: 2-day online camp offers positivity skill training for teens
content: MiTran Global’s Imparting Positivity Camp offers a two-day online programme for teens aged 11–17, blending academic skills with emotional resilience; register now at https://hub.mitranglobal.com/services/ipc

title: Japan PM Takaichi calls PM Modi, hopes for ‘golden chapter’ in ties with India
content: The conversation focused on the Quad, economic and defence cooperation; no clarity on summit dates yet

title: Campaigning heats up for Nuapada bypoll in Odisha as BJP, Cong., BJD vie for victory
content: As the constituency has a heterogeneous population, political parties cannot afford a one-size-fits-all strategy to win the trust of voters

title: Cyber thieves outpace banks’ response time in cybercrime cases in Tamil Nadu
content: While some bank officials, fully aware of the Reserve Bank of India’s guidelines on customer liability, attempt to shift responsibility, others end up misleading victims, at times even advising them to change their registered mobile numbers, instead of taking immediate remedial action.

title: M.B. Patil blames Centre’s incentives to Andhra Pradesh for Google setting up AI data centre in Visakhapatnam
content: Minister for Large and Medium Industries M.B. Patil has blamed the Centre’s incentives to Andhra Pradesh behind Google’s choice for setting up its AI Data Centre in Visakhapatnam

title: Indian IT industry big contributor to business-driven air travel and carbon footprint: Report
content: Enforcing sustainable travel policies such as flying economy, choosing non-stop flights, trains or buses, and capping frequent flyer trips are among the recommendations made to IT companies in a report on the ‘Urgency and Potential of Aviation Impact Mitigation In India’

title: Karnataka govt. mulls law to implement internal reservation
content: The Karnataka Scheduled Castes (Sub-classification) Bill, 2025, which is ready, will be piloted in the winter session of the legislature

title: LDF, UDF lock horns over audit reports at Kochi Corporation Council meeting
content: While the LDF, led by Mayor M. Anilkumar, contended that the audit reports revealed corruption and profligacy during the previous UDF administration, the Opposition argued that the reports were tabled in the council in violation of the Kerala Municipality Act

title: Cyclone Montha: DISCOMs incur loss of ₹17.84 crore on account of damages to infra
content: Over 11,000 employees from various cadres were deployed in the affected areas to prevent interruptions to electricity supply, says Chief Secretary

title: Bengaluru start-ups captured a whopping $38 bn from VCs during 2020-24: Priyank Kharge
content: Despite a global meltdown, Karnataka-based start-ups have raised $1.7 billion of funds in the first half of 2025, the highest by any State

title: Netizens hail MLA’s proud post on wife’s achievement
content: A postgraduate in mathematics, Thiruvambady MLA Linto Joseph’s wife K. Anusha is now part of the Kerala Armed Police Women’s battalion

title: District-level panel to examine complaints on waste treatment factory
content: Latest field-level study reports by PCB and Suchitwa Mission to be discussed before giving nod to reopen the waste treatment plant

title: EPFO to simplify claim processes, conduct awareness campaign
content: Karnataka has 60,000 business establishments registered with EPFO, of which 38,000 are in Bengaluru alone, cumulatively covering some 72 to 78 lakh of subscribers

title: Eco Sense scholarships for students launched
content: Rolled out by Local Self-Governments department and General Education department, it aims at nurturing ecologically sensible citizens

title: Cyclone Montha leaves 2 dead, flattens crops in A.P.
content: Agricultural crops across 87,000 hectares inundated; the severe cyclonic storm also damaged roads and bridges, and uprooted trees, officials said; CM takes stock of damage, says loss of life and property minimised due to measures taken by the State government

title: Sizeable number of militants neutralised during Operation Sindoor: Rajnath
content: Defence Minister praises Prime Minister Narendra Modi for restoring India’s pride and stature on the global stage. He says the Opposition’s election promise of providing a government job to every household is unrealistic and misleading.

title: Karnataka High Court directs KEA not to finalise third round allotment of seats to medical and dental courses for now
content: The primary grievance of the petitioners is that less meritorious students, based on their NEET rank, were allotted seats in the provisional list announced for the third round owing to the procedure and the criteria adopted for allotment of seats in the third round of counselling

title: Mayawati seeks Muslim support, targets rival parties for neglecting minorities
content: The former chief minister accused both the SP and Congress of historically engaging in politics that was “anti-Dalit, anti-backward, and anti-Muslim”

title: Political parties reiterate their opinion on SIR at meeting chaired by CEO
content: While the ruling DMK questioned the timing of the exercise, the principal Opposition party, the AIADMK, welcomed it.

title: Supreme Court decides to examine reasons behind chronic delay in trial courts to frame charges, links it to pendency
content: Section 251 (1) (b) of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (BNSS) mandates that charges must be framed within 60 days in cases triable by a Court of Session

title: Congress accuses Modi government of reviving Manusmriti principles in labour policy
content: Congress general secretary (communications) Jairam Ramesh claimed that the RSS had opposed the Constitution soon after its adoption for not being based on the Manusmriti

title: 1.3 million vehicles hit Hyderabad IT corridor despite continuous rain; staggered work hours help avert gridlock
content: Officials reported a 30% increase in cars and 8% rise in auto-rickshaws compared to normal days as continuous rains drove more commuters to use personal and covered transport

title: Draft DPR for ORR facelift ready: Features 10-lane road, bus priority corridor, cycling lanes
content: The project will revive the now-defunct 3.75-m-wide Bus Priority Lane (BPL) on both sides — a move aimed at reducing congestion and choke points

title: Cyclone Montha: 13.56 lakh power consumers affected in 11 districts, ₹10.47 cr. loss incurred by APEPDCL
content: The cyclone impacted 13 towns, 67 mandals, 1,234 villages, 255 33KV substations, 192 33KV feeders, 1226 LT electricity poles and 17,700 agricultural service connections.

title: Central Pay Commission’s terms of reference rigid: AITUC general secretary
content: All India Trade Union Congress (AITUC) leader Amarjeet Kaur says decision to form CPC was announced before Delhi Assembly polls in Delhi but went to the cold storage till the Bihar election; she says it is an injustice on the government staff to wait for nearly two years for its implementation

title: India focused on technology driven transformation of justice system: Law Minister
content: The Minister said the justice system will also be made business friendly to promote India as an investment destination
